name: Acceptance criteria - Survey boundaries clearly define the Earthworks Type C Construction works.
• Lot diagram to be provided clearly marking up extents of lot area.
• Lot size with no more than one day’s production
Freq - Prior to start of works
Ref docs - VR Clause 204.03 (a) IFC Drawings
Acceptance criteria - Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works as per IFC drawings.
Ref docs - VR Clause 204.10(b) Construction Document
Acceptance criteria - No fill to be placed until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
Acceptance criteria - Spread and compact in layers not exceeding a compacted thickness of 300 mm.

• Where Type C material contains 25% or more of rock by volume, which will not break down during compaction to meet the maximum particle dimension required for a 300 mm thick layer, the loose thickness of each layer may equal the maximum particle dimension of the rock up to a maximum layer thickness of 500 mm.

• Rocks with a maximum particle dimension of less than 800 mm may be placed in Type C material zones as specified, with sufficient spacing between larger rocks to enable full compaction of the Type C material.
• The material shall be placed and compacted such that voids are completely filled with fine material.
• Material shall be compacted at minimum moisture ratio of 80%
• Material Compliance Certificates & Material Approval Register
• VicRoads registration of recycled material blend (if applicable)
Ref docs - VR Clause 204.10(c) 204.10(d) Construction Document
Acceptance criteria - Placement surface textured to ensure layers keyed into each other.

• Where a fill is to be constructed on steep sideling ground or against an existing embankment with side slope steeper than 4 horizontally to 1 vertically, benches shall be progressively cut over the full area to be covered by new fill.
• The width of each bench shall be such as to permit safe and effective operation of plant but shall be not less than 1 m.
Ref docs - VR Clause Table 204.131 Table 204.141 Table 204.142 173.04(d) Table PS3020.072
Acceptance criteria - All areas of the job will be considered as scale A.
○ Scale A Testing: HWKR Rd, Princes Freeway, All Freeway Interchange Ramps, All other arterial roads.
○ Scale B Testing: All other local roads, SUP.
○ Type C Material should meet the following compaction:
○ Type C material is to be tested as per table 201.141 and table 201.142. And should meet the moisture content requirements as per VR204.
○ >70% for any material within 150mm of subgrade.
○ >80% for all material below cut floor level.
Acceptance criteria - Type C material shall be capable of being spread in layers of not more than 500 mm and compacted as specified to achieve a stable condition.
4.3 - Reduced Frequency Post compaction testing of initial lots.
Ref docs - VR Clause 204.14 Table 204.142 PS3020.07 (f)
Acceptance criteria - Testing of compaction for each lot as per Table 204.142
• If Reduced frequency has been granted, the testing can be conducted at the following frequency:
• Compaction will only be required for every 6th lot.
5.1 - Conformity with IFC Drawings and Construction Tolerances
Acceptance criteria - Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross-sectional specified or shown on the drawings.
Does the final product conform to the above criterial?
5.2 - Preparation of Final Surface. (For Underside of Pavement Layers and the surface of the Cut Floor).
Acceptance criteria - Surface is Smooth, Hard, Tightly Bound and Free from Depressions Capable of Holding Water.
• Material within 150 mm of subgrade shall be maintained such that its moisture content is not less than 70% of OMC prior to the placement of any pavement layers.
Does the final product conform to the above criterial?
Acceptance criteria - All Test reports received and reviewed
Acceptance criteria - All Product Non-Conformance(s) recorded and closed (if applicable)
Lot Status
values: Awaiting Hold Point Release, Awaiting NCR Closure, Awaiting Test Results, Awaiting Verification, Cancelled, Closed-out, Outstanding, Work In Progress
